I've got a plan to end lobbying as we know it‚Äîbut strengthening Congress‚Äô independence requires us to do more. We must invest in resources to allow members of Congress to make informed decisions without relying on self-interested outside sources.

And when Congress votes on restoring net neutrality protections, our representatives shouldn‚Äôt have to turn to internet service providers to explain whether their industry needs more regulation. https://www.fastcompany.com/40507541/amid-net-neutrality-debate-biggest-isps-spent-at-least-26-3-million-on-lobbying

When Congress decides whether it should break up big tech companies, our representatives shouldn‚Äôt have to rely on Google‚Äôs policy team to understand the effects of technology consolidation. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tech-lobbying/google-facebook-spend-big-on-u-s-lobbying-amid-policy-battles-idUSKCN1PG2TD

When Congress debates the #GreenNewDeal, our representatives shouldn‚Äôt have to rely on Exxon lobbyists to explain who should pay for the effects of carbon emissions on our planet. https://www.politico.com/story/2016/05/exxon-climate-campaign-222920

I saw firsthand how this system works when I was fighting for the CFPB. Financial reform is complicated, and bank lobbyists bombarded Congress with complex arguments and obscure terms. It's the ultimate insiders‚Äô play: "Trust us because we understand it and you don‚Äôt."

Over the last 20 years, lobbyist spending has skyrocketed. At the same time, Congress has been starved of resources to objectively analyze complex public policy issues, leaving corporate lobbyist propaganda to fill the gap. I've got a plan to fix that: http://elizabethwarren.com/plans/congressional-independence

In my summer travels across #Ohio, I learned a lot from #Ohioans about their priorities & what they need from the federal gov. This fall, I‚Äôll continue to fight for all #Ohioans & make sure we‚Äôre passing legislation that makes a positive difference in people‚Äôs lives.

My travels across Ohio also allowed me to meet with farmers, the backbone of an agricultural industry that contributes more than $100 billion to #Ohio‚Äôs economy every year. We discussed how heavy storms have hurt the ag. community this year & the need to pass #USMCA.

I also met w/ a number of groups working to combat the addiction crisis across #Ohio. State & local organizations have been able to use federal resources provided by laws like my #CARA and #CURES to design innovative approaches to preventing and treating addiction.

I discussed my bipartisan #JOBSAct with community colleges, high school #CTE programs, and businesses all across #Ohio, as it will help close the skills gap and get more individuals into short-term training programs.

I met with #smallbiz owners who told me how they‚Äôve benefited from the major #taxreform law enacted in 2017. They‚Äôve used their tax savings to grow their businesses, increase wages for their workers, & hire more employees. We also discussed the need for skilled workers.

It was a great opportunity to learn more about the priorities of Ohioans across the state & how DC can help. I was able to see firsthand how some of the laws I‚Äôve passed are working to address the #opioidepidemic & expand workforce training. #SORGrants #CARA #STOPACT #JOBSAct

This summer, I traveled more than 4000 miles across #Ohio in my pickup & had 75 meetings w/ farmers, #smallbiz owners, factory workers, police officers, drug counselors, recovering addicts & others in 39 #Ohio counties.
